Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. I was looking at various hotels for weeks on TripAdvisor before I finally decided to stay at this hotel and certainly don't regret it. We stayed in a two bedroom- one King, one Queen bed suite. Traveling with two elderly parents this has been the ideal room layout. This Homewood also serves a nice complementary breakfast every morning every day of the week, with a manager's reception at night Monday through Thursday evening. I must say that the service and staff are second to none. I am not usually a high maintenance guest, but for this trip I felt like I had made a number of requests, which the staff happily helped me with. The staff are very friendly and the front desk extremely helpful as well as patient. The rooms are very clean and well kept, although the bedrooms were slightly smaller than I thought looking at the pictures online, it still had plenty of room to walk around. I'm all about clean rooms and friendly helpful staff. I give his place 5 stars, and will be staying here again on my next trip to San Diego. In terms of distance, it's about a 15-20 minute drive to Sea World and 15-20 minute drive to the San Diego zoo. You could definitely go back to your room for lunch after spending time in the parks in the morning, take a nap and go back in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way. Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzers
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a 26 day road trip and absolutely LOVED it. We chose this hotel based on TA reviews and I can fully understand it being the # 1 hotel in San Diego. We had booked a one bedroom suite via Expedia but found on checkin that we had been upgraded to a large two bedroom / two bathroom, fully equipped apartment at no extra cost. Free wi-fi is included in all rooms. The property is very new, well laid out and in a very convenient location if you have a car. There are quite a few restaurants and a supermarket nearby if required. All the staff were phenomenal in their dedication to customer service - they deserve a medal in this regard. The free breakfast and "light" dinner were another bonus which we really appreciated and enjoyed very much. Thumbs up Homewood Suites Liberty Station - keep up the great work you are doing! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: redfarb
Reviews.Content: I'm hard to please and I liked this hotel. Itâ€™s a simple place right across the street from a Navy base. There are lots of military personnel and families staying there. My wife and two sons (12 and 8) booked a two bedroom suite for $399 a night. Room was just big enough and the pool was small but clean/fun. The free breakfast was pretty much what you should expect for a free breakfast. Itâ€™s in a small shopping center so there are other places to get food close by. Staff were personable and helpful when asked. We needed to be in downtown SD and this was a perfect fit - just far enough away from downtown and no more than 10 or 15 minutes from Balboa Park and other attractions. I plan to try Homewood again on a family outing.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: NallaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We returned to Vancouver BC last evening after spending two nights at the Homewood Suites, Lanning Road San Diego. Everything about this hotel is excellent, the staff, the rooms, the complementary breakfasts,the pool and with only a 5 minute drive to the airport. Have already recommended it to friends. Al Oct / 08

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gotthetravelbugnow
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Homewood and loved our time there. We were only sorry we didn't have longer there! We chose a two bedroom suite which had two bathrooms and enough space for our family of four. Rooms were well appointed and being only 12 months old everything was still in excellent condition. My only regret was we had a side room and I would have loved one with a water view. Breakfast had plenty of variety and consisted of both hot and cold choices. Dinner is supplied free of charge on Monday through to Thursday nights. As our stay was Friday through to Tuesday we only had one night of dinner included and it was very nice. They say a light dinner but we found it more than adequate and it even included wine and light beer! Within the hotel complex (about a 150 metre walk) are several restaurants including a Japanese, Thai, Greek, Mexican, Subway and Oggi's (Italian) as well as a wine shop and frozen yogurt shop. I felt this provided plenty of variety and we visited the bulk of these and had no complaints about any of our meals. Also close by is a small shopping complex with a huge Vons supermarket. It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is a little out of the centre of San Diego in a quiet neighbourhood so your own transport is recommended. The airport is close by but didn't pose any real problems with noise. I note others have complained of the smell in the area (apparently generated from the creek) but again we didn't experience this and spent a fair bit of time outside in the pool area where you would note this smell if it were a problem. Speaking of the pool area, it was a really nice place to relax and unwind. The spa was nicely heated as was the pool and plenty of seating was available. The weather was good and some nights we used the pool until it closed at 10pm. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and I highly recommend both this accommodation and San Diego be included in your itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Nana069
Reviews.Content: We spent one of the best weeks we have ever had on vacation staying at the Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station. I spent approximately 15 hours online going over and over reviews before choosing Homewood Suites. My husband said the time really paid off, for this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The grounds are lovely with a walkway along the inlet right on the property. There are two outdoor gas fireplaces that were so nice to sit around on cool nights. If you desire to grill your own meal, there are two gas grills. There is a variety of restaurants within walking distance and the hotel is only 1.5 blocks from public transportatiion. We had planned to rent a car, but decided to wait to see if we needed it. The mass transportation in San Diego is clean, safe, and extremely affordable. We did not spend all week what one day of car rental would have cost. We wanted a suite, but has not imagined we could afford one. The cost of our room, especially considering the meals provided, was a bargain. We had expected breakfast, but what we received was BREAKFAST, including scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns, juice, hot and cold cereal, waffles, yogurt. fresh melon and fruit, plus coffee and hot chocolate. One morning we had sausage gravy and biscuits, (my favorite). We were also lucky to have our visit coincide with the nights Homewood Suites provide an evening meal (Monday thru Thursday). It was so nice to come back to our room in the evening and know there was a hot meal awaiting us. These meals also include complimentary wine and beer. The hotel is fairly new so it is nicely decorated and well maintained. The service was exceptional, with one desk attendant delivering information to our room that we had requested. There is a business center, but internet connection is available in the room, also. The only criticism we had was there was only one sink in the bathroom area and it was in front of the closet so the space was close. This could present a problem for a family with several people to get ready at the same time. I would recommend this hotel for all groups. It was the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: zansu
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites in general are great for families, and the Liberty Station/San Diego Airport location is no exception. The rooms are standard for a HS - comfortable beds, Neutrogena bath products, full kitchen -- as are the meals (breakfast and weekday dinner). The staff is very friendly and gave each of the kids (four in our extended family group) their own drawstring bag with a beach ball and visor. We had a two bedroom suite for two adults and two kids, so we had more than enough room. Pool is nice, with towels supplied. There's a deck on the third floor with a telescope, so you can watch the planes take off. The property is located in an area that used to be part of the Navy Training Center but is now being redeveloped. There is a Courtyard by Marriott next door, and a retail area that includes a good pizza place (Oggi's), Subway, Los Primos (Mexican), a Greek place, and a Starbucks. Close by is a Trader Joe's, Cold Stone, and other dining options. The property backs onto an inland waterway, so there are boats, water skiers, and birds to watch. Grass, gravel and paved paths run along the water, and connect the hotel to a large park. There is a play area about 5-7 minute walk with a play structure and a climbing wall. Tons of grassy areas. Minutes from the airport, convention center and Sea World. I do not rank this property as excellent due to the smell of the offgassing from the furniture. This is common in new furniture, but still unpleasant. It is noticeable when returning to the room at the end of the day, and dissipates quickly after opening all of the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family suites”
Reviews.Author: Annettefullofjello
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel in a magazine article about family travel deals and this hotel was listed as a family-friendly hotel. I booked a two bedroom suite as there were four adults. I was soooo pleased when we arrived. We had a full kitchen fully stocked with supplies, a dining table, small livingroom with a fold out couchbed, two bedrooms and two baths all for a very reasonable price because we split it with the other couple. The price included a breakfast every morning and a small dinner Mon thru Thurs. Lovely hotel and only a year old so everything was so new. Airport noise was not at all an issue and this hotel was close to everything you would want to do in San Diego. We all loved our stay and have no complaints. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: MJN_slc
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel last week (early September) - 4 adults and 2 toddlers. We had a 2 bedroom unit with suite. Overall it was a great hotel for the family - and there were many other families with kids there also. The rooms were new and clean, and the living room was spacious and clean with a nice kitchen area. The breakfast included was a great start to each day. It is really a great property with a nice waterfront walkway on the back - lot's of room for the toddlers to run around. It is located a short drive from both Seaworld and the San Diego Zoo, and very close to downtown and the airport. The airport noise wasn't a problem for us. The only negative (kept me from giving it 5 stars) is the interior doors in the unit. They are hollow and didn't prevent noise from traveling between the bedrooms and living room. The toddler could hear the TV or Hair Dryer in our parents room at night (adjacent to her bed in the living room) and made it difficult for her to get to sleep. However, it wasn't a huge problem, just inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonjamdti
Reviews.Content: We (two parents, three teenage girls) visited the hotel in late July having booked on the Hilton website a few months earlier. The two bedroom suite was great- clean and quiet , beds comfortable and the kitchen living area spacious. Staff were very helpful, pool fine, breakfasts a little crowded but food good. We never made it to the evening meal. The location is good didn't notice the airport. Seemed very close to all the things we wanted to see, shopping area (Vons, Trader J) 10 min walk, some places to eat just across the car park. Can't really think of a single problem.

Reviews.Title: “Overall was pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMari
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at another Homewood Suites in the past and was very happy there, so we expected this one to be similar. It was in that the room was spacious. We had the two bedroom two bathroom unit which was large enough for the five of us. It was spotless and the maid service was terrific. The building itself was also very clean. You could tell that the hotel was pretty new. There is a shuttle which picked us up and brought us to the airport which was very nice. The breakfast was plentiful and of a wide variety-there were cold cereals, hot cereal, milk, juice, eggs, breads, rolls, home fries, and make your own Belgian waffles. The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. They assisted with directions and maps to theme parks and other attractions when we needed them. The pool was heated and delightful. We thought that the food at the other Homewood Suites was better in that they had more of a selection-they had pbj sandwiches and yogurt if you did not like the dinner they served. The hotel is located in a quiet naval community. Even though it is very close to the airport, we did not hear any planes inside our room. The hotel is also within walking distance of many eating places-pizza, greek, mexican, and ice cream, and several shopping areas with supermarkets, drug stores, retail stores, and others are within a short driving distance. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights for a conference, and it worked great for us and another couple we know. The staff was wonderful, the evening reception (Monday - Thursday only) was prettty good, and the breakfasts were good every day. There are several good restaurants right out the front door, and more about 1/2 mile away in the Liberty Station shopping center. You can also get groceries, etc. at Trader Joe's and Von's in Liberty Station. The rooms are spacious enough - larger than many condos in San Diego. You also have a full-size refrigerator, cook top, microwave and dishwasher. No oven, though. There are gas grills on the patio. For relaxation, there's a small basketball court, pool and hot tub, and miles of walking paths along the harbor and nearby parks. Though I'd rather have the convenience of staying downtown, this hotel worked great for us and it's a lot less costly than the downtown hotels. Take the 923 bus to go downtown or to Ocean Beach, but remember this bus stops running about 7pm. And, yes - I'd stay here again. In fact, I've already reserved a week here for next year's conference.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: RoyalDuce
Reviews.Content: At best Sub Par. This hotel has nothing impressive and did i mention right next to the smoggy airport. The rooms slightly stunk, and were not that clean. I did enjoy the breakfast 7 days a week, but the welcome home reception only is served 4 of the 7 days. Weak. My next trip to san diego will not be with homewood suites. I have been a gold hilton honors memember for years and wish i would have stayed at the Embassy suites down town.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trv71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely wonderful...luxury at its best! The surroundings are breathtaking! The hotel room are comfy and clean. The perfect bed away from home! Breakfast buffet is fantastic. The staff is smiling, friendly and helpful! One of the best hotels in San Diego...Superb experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OfcSupport
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! My son and I tagged along while my husband was away on business. We loved the location and all of the amenities the hotel had to offer. Our teenage son played basketball there, used the pool table and swimming pool. The landscaping and outdoor areas are beautiful. We stayed in a studio suite. Friends of ours had a one bedroom suite. With the exception of the additional television I actually preferred the studio suite. I liked the open floor plan better. The location is great. Read the other reviews on that. Oggi's right next door has great pizza. Two grocery stores are very close to the hotel. The staff was very helpful. They printed a boarding pass for me when I was having difficulty, provided us with directions and took care of anything we asked of them. We ate the light dinner one evening and appreciated it. We also had breakfast there each morning. I would say if you are staying there more than a few days you may tire of the same breakfast every day. They do have a variety but really only seem to switch from bacon to sausage. I have been at other Hilton properties, Hampton Inn, in particular that have had better breakfasts. I didn't care for the potatoes or eggs they served. Having said that they do offer oatmeal and waffles and other items so we never really went hungry. Housekeeping was great. They do not have in-room safes. We used the hotel shuttle from the airport. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait. After an hour I called the hotel back and a van arrived. The van has a large green Marriott emblem on the hood and side of the van. On the side behind the Marriott logo is the Homewood Suites logo in a light color. The courtesy area is very busy at the airport and I was only able to see the Marriott logo when the van initially went around and ignored it. An hour later when the driver showed up there were no vehicles around it and I caught a glimpse of the Homewood Suites logo. I wished they would have told me when I phoned for the shuttle to look for a van with both logos on it. I wonder how often they have to return because people miss that. My husband was traveling with co-workers. We chose this property because the "W" hotel was sold out. They finished their work a few days earlier. The guys that stayed at the "W" were forced to pay for the next day because they did not give 24 hours notice. My husband checked with the staff around dinner time the night before and they had no problem with him checking out the next morning. We have family in this area and most definately will stay here again. This property is at the very top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property & location though pricey”
Reviews.Author: Marsh511
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights with a family of 4 (w/ wife, 7, 5 yr old girls) on our annual San Diego visit. We need SPACE when we travel as a family, so we always look for a 2-bedroom suite. WIth this stay, Homewood has now taken over our #1 spot from the Staybridge chain. This property is located in a deceptively convenient location, about 8-10 minutes from the airport, 10+ minutes to Sea World or Old Town, and just over 15 minutes from places like Seaport Village, Petco Park, and Gaslamp District (though I'd imagine during rush hour, this could double). We were also able to WALK across the parking lot to no less than SIX good places to eat for families (nothing fancy...but a great Greek restaurant and an pub/pizza/Italian place Oggi's were typical). There's also a Starbucks and Subway there. Not only that, Homewood properties serve a darn good evening snack which almost works as a meal (meatloaf, lasagne, tacos, etc.), at least for the kids. The 2-bedroom suites are similar to other chains' 2-BDs - but the middle living room and kitchen area seemed more spacious than Residence Inn, Summerfield Suites, or Staybridge...and the property was absolutely spotless! This hotel has a better-than-adequate pool as well as eating area...though because of the summer vacation high occupancy, finding seating during breakfast was a little tough. Still, there are many outdoor tables just outside the dining area that served as a great overflow for many families. In the evenings, a few parties were using the outdoor grill to cook up their own burgers, etc. All in all, this property seemed to be planned very meticulously. On the downside: (a) meal service workers were like timekeeping Nazi's - by 9:30 a.m SHARP, pretty much every food item was put away, and when I wandered over to see what was still out and to try to get one more cup of orange juice, one worker sternly eyed me and barked out "We stop serving at 9:30." During the summer, it would be great if this hotel kept weekend hours (to 10 a.m.) for breakfasts every day. The breakfast food selection at this Homewood didn't have quite the same variety or quality as a Homewood I stayed in Texas last month...but still much better than adequate. (b) Elevators are *extremely* slow...and few. A property of this size could use 2 sets of elevators per building...and they can certainly move a little faster. During room clean-up time (which may be pretty much all day), the housekeeping crew did not appear to have their own elevators, so they frequently tied up the single elevator (per building) with their carts and maintenance items. Try to get a room that faces either the parking lot (still a nice view of hills and the recently completed Liberty Landing/Navy Training Center commercial complex) or the Bay. I would opt for the non-premium (not "Bay View") rooms on a high floor (3 or 4) as this would keep your costs a bit lower. Try to avoid the rooms that face the between-building walkways, especially on the 1st 2 levels as there's a lot of pedestrian traffic, mostly hotel guests coming and going...but they seem very close when your room faces the walkway. At $284/night, this was one of the most expensive 2-bedroom suites we've stayed at, but considering the time of year and location, I still feel we got a good deal. And kudos to the housekeeping crew who did a terrific job cleaning our room every day, and managed to do so without misplacing or losing any of our kids' stuff (you know how 5 & 7 years olds drop or leave crayons, books, and stuffed animals *anywhere*) -- instead, they neatly arranged items they found on top of the dresser. AND, they did all of this with a very limited window of time as we tended to come back to our room several times daily, and we'd put up the "Privacy" sign often. Still, they found the time to do an excellent job cleaning and prepping our room every day. Oh...our suite also had 3 fantastic 37 or 40" (didn't measure LOL) LCD TV's that kept everyone happy in the evenings. If you have a PS3 or WII or another video console, BRING IT!! On second thought, your kids may never want to leave the room... I give this property my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: heathrowterminal3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and wow! what a joy! We wanted somewhere with easy access to the area and we got it! Free parking - Free wifi - Free breakfast - and the bonus - Mon to Thur night they make you a free dinner! It is a buffet meal from 530p to 730p and each night is a different choice. We had tacos one night, then meatloaf, then chicken and then finally lasagna. It includes free wine, beer or lemonade. There is a really nice pool, BBQ area, an outdoor fireplace to lounge in front of and a really nice area to walk along the "canal". If the full kitchen doesn't temp you for lunch or dinner the other 3 nights of the week then there are loads of places to eat nearby. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: G8RED
Reviews.Content: My expectations were so high after reading all the reviews. When we drove up I began to feel that maybe we made a mistake (not that it was going to be horrible but that this might be just a typical chain hotel). Oh boy was I wrong! From the momemt of check in, to the rooms, to the service to the amenities this place is unbelievable. I had to laugh because we just came from a hotel in Dana Point (Holiday Inn Express) that costs about the same as this one but the two could not have been on opposite ends of the spectrum in terms of quality. 2 Full Bedroom suites seperated by a full kitchen and living room. 3 High Def LG LCD TVs. Full breakfast and nice dinner all included in the bill. Pool table room, nice swimming pool area. This place was getting a high volume of people running through it and there staff was perfect at cleaning up and making you feel like you were staying at home (actually that is not a true statement because at home we would not keep our place this spotless all the time). We also loved the location = they have a nice walking/jogging path along a lake or ocean inlet. Right next door is a plaza full of brand new stores offering all kinds of food options. There is even a massage place that was brand new and offering a one time introductory massage for $ 39 (hour)/$ 57 (1.5 hours) that both my wife and I took advantage of. We LOVED and LOVE this place and will stay here anytime we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: wessa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many nice hotels in the San Diego area over the years. We have decided that from now on, if this hotel is available, we will always opt to to stay here. Very, very clean everywhere, which is a huge priority to us. Rooms are large and comfortable. Great central location to all that San Diego has to offer. Used the exercise room every morning, had their bkfst once and it was just fine. Incredibly helpful staff. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cramos6269
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from July 3 - July 6 and we had a blast. This hotel was constructed September of last year. We stayed at a 2 bedroom suite. The room is very clean. The Kitchen is so complete. From utensils to pots and pans, plates, cups and glasses. The kitchen has 2 burners, microwave, full size refrigerator, coffee maker, dishwasher. Everything that you need. The Breakfast is awesome too. You can hardly find a hotel that serves hot breakfast. There's a lot of choices. eggs, bacon, sausages, bread, :make your own waffle, juice, milk, oatmeal, fruits and cottage cheese. They also have a lighted sports court where you can also play there at night. The swimming pool is clean. Also the parking is free, unlike other hotels in San Diego where you have to pay for parking. They have a laundry room and exercise room. The staff are totally friendly. There is a bridge there , walking distance leading you to a park. We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. They are very accomodating and very generous on everything. Check out time is 12N. We will surely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: moo_bear
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in San Diego (at the end of a loooong cross country road trip), I thought perhaps we had made a mistake and that we might have been better staying at a hotel closer to downtown or to one of the beaches. But I was wrong - this hotel was perfect. We had to wait a while for our room to be ready (5:30), but when we got to our 2-bedroom suite, we were very pleased with it - although slightly disappointed that the view was of the car park, rather than the water. The suite was very nicely furnished, spacious and comfortable. The A/C was a little loud and if you turned it off, you could hear other peoples' - but that was not a big deal to us. The staff were very friendly and helpful - the breakfast was good - and the location was excellent, being close to a myriad fast food restaurants, Trader Joe's etc. The seating area outside was beautiful. We stayed for 3 nights and were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room with nice view”
Reviews.Author: ILnaturetrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for two nights the last week of April. It was close to the airport and to Point Loma. We went to the zoo, Coronado Beach, Cabrillo National Monument & Sunset Cliffs. They were all a short drive from the hotel. The breakfast was a normal Homewood spread and was good. We did not try the supper. Having a Subway, Panera Bread and Starbucks in the same vicinity was nice for lunch and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Red007houston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and we liked everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were great. Location is close to everything. The only problem I had is I wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but clean”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: I flew down with my mom to check out the hotel for future visits with our 2 young children. Staff were friendly and check in was smooth. Our room looked directly at the pool ground level and it was suprisingly quiet. I slept on the pull out couch and it was comfortable. There are 2 great playgrounds within walking distance for young children and the one over the bridge has a sandy beach. The only negative to this place is you must have a car. We took taxi's but it was expensive to go anywhere. And don't let the staff call you a cab because they called a private guy who cost more. We did walk to a local Trader Joe's, Starbucks and fabulous grocery store but it would be too far with young children. Breakfast buffet was great. I couldn't find a tip jar for staff during breakfast which I think should be mandatory and may explain why others have said they weren't friendly. Overall I'd recommend this for young families with a car. I might try staying closer to town though as its a bit in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....but”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1968Ohio
Reviews.Content: The other reviews written on the hotel list just about everything that we liked here. It was a very nice property. We arrived early at 11:00am and they actually said that our room was ready and we could check in immediately instead of waiting until 3:00 pm. The only two things that we didn't care for that much was our room location and the lack of space in the dining area. Do not get a room by the exercise facilities if possible. People would be exercising at 4:00 am in the morning with the TV turned up really loud. They have a "open 24 hours a day" policy on their exercise rooms. That's just crazy!! Several times my husband had to go over into the exercise room after the person left and turn off the TV. The management finally put a sign up after we complained. The other thing that was a little frustrating was the lack of space in the dining area at meal times. A free breakfast is offered every morning and a free dinner is offered Monday thru Thursday. We found that no matter what time we went down to eat it was crowded. We would have to find a table first and then take turns going to get our food. This was not so good with two small children as we had to make many trips through the crowd back and forth. That got really old after a couple of days. Other than these two things, we really enjoyed our stay in the hotel. Everything was clean and our two bedroom suite was very nice. There was a nice, clean play area within walking distance behind the hotel along the bay. The kids had a lot of fun there. There's also a great grocery store called Trader Joe's a short distance from the hotel. They had a good selection of snacks at a reasonable price.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station
HotelInfo.Address: 2576 Laning Road, San Diego, CA 92106
